授業目的:
During Japanese Popular Culture B course students will learn how Japanese popular media are generally involved into media mixes. Media mixes are multimedia franchises that develop narrative across multiple platforms that share same world, characters, and may continue each other, or present different versions of the same events. Leaning onto methodological approaches of Thomas LaMarre, Stevie Suan, Azuma Hiroki, Mark Steinberg, etc, we will explore different facets of full animation, anime, and media mix from the perspective of history, media-studies, reception studies, and other.
Finally, we will look at fan-created derivative contents, such as: dōjinshi, fan art, fan fiction, cosplay, and other practices.
到達目標: Through a combination of lectures, student presentation, analysis of works and discussion, we will gain awareness of the development, interrelationship of popular media and its cultural role.
